sentences.english: He invested his lawyer with complete power to act for him.
sentences.chinese: 他授权律师全权代他诉讼。

sentences.english: He'll stick at nothing to get complete power.
sentences.chinese: 为了揽取全权，他什么都干得出来。

sentences.english: I don't know enough about it to decide, so I'll pass the buck to you.
sentences.chinese: 我所知有限，不能决定，所以请全权处理。

sentences.english: The special commission was invested with full authority to handle the current situation.
sentences.chinese: 这个特别委员会被授予全权处理当前局势。

sentences.english: Why are we drifting deeper and deeper into socialism and the dark night of totalitarianism?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们在社会主义和黑暗的全权主义中越陷越深？

sentences.english: The documents shall be held by the issuing bank at the disposal of the seller.
sentences.chinese: 开证行应掌握单据，由卖方全权处理。

sentences.english: TVB had full discretion every year to cut out any parts of the show from its broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 无线电视每年均有全权选择在转播时剪掉任何内容。

sentences.english: The minister is given plenipotentiary power in the trade negotiation .
sentences.chinese: 该部长获有全权进行贸易谈判。

sentences.english: AP: Why did you decide to take total control of your record this time around?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么这次决定要全权处理你的唱片？

sentences.english: A frame function has the full capabilities of this calling standard at its disposal.
sentences.chinese: 帧函数可以全权处理此调用标准的所有功能。

sentences.english: A person elected by the board of directors chairman, the Plenipotentiary companies.
sentences.chinese: 由董事会选任一人为董事长，全权代表公司。

sentences.english: Take over, finish the mop-up . You're in charge.
sentences.chinese: 接手这个现场由你全权负责。

sentences.english: Please take charge of all things when I am away.
sentences.chinese: 当我不在的时候，你就全权负责。

sentences.english: As an ambassador plenipotentiary he represents the diplomatic image of his country.
sentences.chinese: 作为全权大使，他代表的是国家的外交形象。

sentences.english: The teacher had a free hand in his class.
sentences.chinese: 教师在课堂上可以全权处理一切。

sentences.english: The government controlled everything and ran it into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 政府掌控一切并全权负责。

definition: (political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
in charge (of a position etc)/the person in charge/responsible
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to have no right/to have no authority
